newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-KARLSRUHE KILL OFF ROMA'S COMEBACK HOPES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-KARLSRUHE KILL OFF ROMA'S COMEBACK HOPES.

text.p: Germany's Karlsruhe killed off Roma's hopes of a UEFA Cup comeback on Tuesday despite conceding two first half goals by Argentine striker Abel Balbo in the space of five minutes at the Olympic Stadium.
The Germans lost the second-round second-leg clash 2-1 on the night but won 4-2 on aggregate.
Roma's Argentine coach Carlos Bianchi, whose team were beaten 3-0 by Karlsruhe in the first leg, threw caution to the wind and almost masterminded an upset.
He ditched the cautious 4-4-2 line-up he usually favours and started with three strikers up front.
In the second half, as Karlsruhe retreated into defence, Francesco Totti came on as a fourth attacker for the Italians.
Roma, unrecognisable from the downcast and disorganised team that has lost twice and drawn once in their last three matches, began briskly and were unlucky not to score more goals.
Balbo slotted in their first after 22 minutes after Marco Delvecchio served up a fine cross into the area.
The Argentine scored again in the 26th. Uruguayan Daniel Fonseca's shot was parried, Delvecchio knocked it past Karlsruhe goalkeeper Claus Rettmaier and Balbo swept the ball home.
But Karlsruhe midfielder Marc Keller made the score 2-1 seven minutes from time with a rasping shot from the edge of the area to shatter Roma's hopes.
"At 2-0 I thought we had done everything we had to do in the first half," Bianchi said. "In the second it was much harder to get at the goal but the team played very well."
